reviews.text: The ACH retry engine must implement a structured retry mechanism for failed debit transactions, adhering to a maximum of three retry attempts per failure, utilizing exponential backoff beginning with a 4-hour delay.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes structured retry mechanism with enforced constraints on retry attempts and delays.

reviews.text: Retries must be disabled for any account marked with the risk_tier field set to "high".
reviews.reason_text: Enforces disabling of retries for high-risk accounts.

reviews.text: A dedicated retry window is enforced over weekends, specifically from Saturday 06:00 UTC to Sunday 22:00 UTC, during which retries may be scheduled and executed.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes enforced scheduling of retries on weekends.

reviews.text: For each failed retry attempt, the engine must POST a failure notification within two minutes to https://ops.webhook.company/retry_failed, ensuring the JSON payload includes the keys txnId, attempt, and reason.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes enforced notification upon retry attempts.

reviews.text: The ach_retry_weekend feature must be controlled via a feature flag, defaulting to OFF in production environments, and may only be enabled upon formal QA approval and sign-off to ensure stability and compliance with operational policies.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes enforced feature flag control with conditions.
